cluster_relations.rel_desc: The color white is symbolically associated with purity.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is culturally or symbolically associated with the object (e.g., a color with an abstract concept) within a specified cultural context.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Western cultures attribute symbolic meanings of purity and cleanliness to the color white.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject culture or cultural group assigns or attributes symbolic meanings to the object (e.g., a color). The specific meanings are carried in qualifiers or separate nodes.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Eastern cultures attribute symbolic meanings of mourning and death to the color white.

args.justification: This relation instance is semantically identical to the other 'symbolically_associated_with' relations in this chunk. Normalizing its canonical_rel_desc to match the shared template used by the others improves schema consistency and reuse of the same predicate description across all symbolic association edges.
